intro: Monanthos subbilobatus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed monanthos, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and often aromatic foliage. The plant typically features narrow, bilobed leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or white in color, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
